description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of paths of n upsteps U and n downsteps D that contain k UUDs.
comments: By reading paths backward, the UUD in the name could be replaced by DDU.Or, triangular array T read by rows: T(n,k)=P(2n,n,4k), where P(n,k,c)=number of vectors (x(1),x(2,),...,x(n)) of k 1's and n-k 0's such that x(i)=x(n+1-i) for exactly c values of i. P(n,k,n) counts palindromes.In nuclear magnetic resonance of n coupled spin-1/2 nuclides, T(n,k) is the number of zero-quantum transitions with combination index k. See the link, containing also yet another interpretation in terms of pairs of binary n-tuples. [_Stanislav Sykora_ Apr 27 2012]
